title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: The Mayor's office, day. The mayor is at her desk, flanked by her assistants. Before her are Chef and Jimbo. The meeting starts

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Gentlemen, I understand you are here to present both sides of an issue. I wanna hear you both out and do this in a civil and constructive manner so that I can give you both the time and attention you deserve. Jimbo, why don't you begin?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Mayor, it's about the South Park flag.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh, Jesus Christ, not this again!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: We cannot change the South Park flag, Mayor!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Mayor, as I've said before, I find that flag to be racist and insensitive!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Chef, I respect you very much, but you have to understand that this has been the South Park flag since some of our ancestors, like my great-grandfather, founded this land!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: That flag represents a time when blacks were persecuted by whites! How can a black man not be bothered by it?!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Ahalright, Chef, I'll have my assistants hold up the flag.  and you tell me what exactly you find racist about it.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: You don't see anything wrong with that flag?!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Chef, what about the baseball team, the Cleveland Indians, huh? Should they change their name because it's racist?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: No, because it's their history!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Look, I have gone to every quiet protest I could! I have written everyone; I've put up signs! But now I'm telling you , THIS FLAG WILL BE CHANGED!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: And I'm telling you it WON'T!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh, boy.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: South Park Elementary, day. The class bell rings and the kids are in their seats. Timmy is now shown with the class.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Okay, children, in Mr. Garrison's absence, I would like to turn the class's attention to current issues. Some people think the South Park flag should be changed, while others believe that changing the flag is wrong. I think this is a perfect subject for your debate club.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Aaaaah!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: I see that you've already had a lot of interesting debates this year.  Pro-Choice vs. Cartman, Pro-Gun Control vs. Cartman, a-and People Against the Clubbing of Baby Seals vs. Cartman. And apparently, the winner of all your debates so far has been... Cartman.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Thaaat's ri-ight.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Cartman doesn't always win! He just gets pissed off and goes home so we can't debate anymore!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Nah-ah! I'm just a better debater than you guys!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: You don't even know what you're debating about half the time!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yes I do!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: No you don't!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh yeah?! Well, screw you guys, I'm going home!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Told ya.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Alright, children, well, unlike Mr. Garrison, I want you all to go out and research this debate before we pick teams. Tomorrow, you'll need to choose which side of this poignant debate you are on.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Jimbo and Ned's lodge, after school. They're sitting on the front porch.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: This is about history, kids.  If you don't have respect for your past, then you can never expect to- BIRD!  -then you can never expect to have a future. Nowadays, everyone wants to change mascots and flags because they're not  "politically correct." Well, where does it end? I mean, people are gonna start sayin' that the Denver Broncos are offensive to horses. And then we'll have to- a SQUIRREL!  Aand then we'll have to change everything, and pretty soon all our history will be forgotten. But to REALLY understand the South Park's flag's importance, you need to know about South Park's history. Ned here's a big history buff, and he can tell you the whole story. Ned?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Nnneh, in 1867, fourteen pioneers from the East Coast traveled across the Plains-

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Uh that, that's okay, dude, I think we got it.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah, we got it.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: You sure?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yup.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: You boys go make me proud now and win that debate- Chris Peterson!  God-damnit, we missed him again!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: South Park Supermarket, after school. Chef is at the entrance with a petition in his hands. With him are Wendy, Bebe, Clyde, and Butters. Some folks head for the store...

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Sign up to join me, and come marchng to the Mayor's office in protest of the South Park flag!  You see that, children?! Nobody wants to get involved! Randy! Sign up to march with me against the South Park flag on Wednesday?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh, uuhh, look, Chef, you know I'm-m not a racist, but uh, I just don't really feel strongly one way or another about the flag.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Well, alright, Marsh, you're entitled to your own opinion.  That's how it is in this town. I haven't gotten one signature on this damn sheet, and I've been here all day!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: We'll march with you, Chef.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: That's nice, but I need the support of some registered voters.  Ey, Mackey! Sign up to march on Wednesday?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oo, Wednesday? Uh-Wednesday's tough. I guess- maybe I could do somthin' uh, Thursday afternoon.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Alright, fudge it, Thursday. Anyone else wanna go Thursday?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Thursday's no good, we've got chior council.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh, yeah.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: What about next Sunday?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Fine! Next Sunday!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: You mean, during the ball game?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh, yeah. We can't do Sunday.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Monday??

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh, I can't do Monday.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: I could do Tuesday.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah, Tuesday morning's good.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: You know what would be better for me is Saturday afternoon.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Saturday is perfect for me.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah. How about Saturday at 11:30?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Mm hmm.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: That sounds good.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Mm hmm.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah, I think that's the best day.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Okay! On Saturday, we march!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh, march? What are we marching for?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: To bring down the South Park Flag!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oohh, I gotta go.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: I know what I may like. I dont like marching

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Uh, marching's really not for me.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: See you later.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Well I've counted up all your secret ballots, childen, and it look like about half of you think the flag should stary, and half think the flag should be changed.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: How could any of you think that flag should stay the way it is?!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Save it for the debate, Wendy. Now I'm going to assign the debate leaders. Who wants to lead the "Flag Should Stay The Way It Is" team?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Me. Me. Me. Me.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Stan?! How could you be so insensitive?!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Whoa, dude, I don't see anything wrong with that flag.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah, me neither.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
role: Mr. Wyland	Alright. Stan and Kyle, [turns and writes on the board]
text: you can both be the team leaders for the "Flag should stay the way it is" team. [turns around. Their names are there now] Now, who wants to lead the "Flag should be changed" team? [an angry Wendy raises her hand. Cartman looks over at her, then raises his hand and chuckles] Okay, Wendy and Eric can team up. [writes their names on the board]

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Nooo!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Alright, children. Do your homework, and let's get ready for a great debate!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: South Park Elementary, cafeteria. Kids enjoy their meals. Craig enters the kitchen, followed by Stan, Kyle, Butters, and someone else

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Hello, Chef.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: My name isn't Chef anymore, children. I've converted to Islam.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Islam??

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: From now on, my name is  Abdul Mohammed Jabar  Rauf Kareem Ali.  With everyone in town so insensitive about the flag, I find it no longer fitting to use my slave name!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Well, we need help with our debate club. We have to explain why we think the flag should not be changed.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: You WHAT?!  You don't think they should change the flag?!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Not really.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah, we don't see what the big deal is.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Well, that figures you don't! Because your cracker-ass parents turned you into little cracker-ass cracker-racists! I never thought I'd live to see this many of the people I considered friends turn against me!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: But Chef, we don't know what you're talking about.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: But nothin'!  "But" my ass! Fix your own damn food!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: South Park Elementary, school library. Wendy has assembled her team and leads them through preliminary items. In her team are Bebe, Clyde, Butters, Token, Kevin, and three others. Cartman is not there yet.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Okay. Now, in order for us the debate to change the South Park flag, we will need to do a lot of research. Now, my plan is to divide up into three research teams. We will present our arguments based on things that w-

text: Nice of you to show up! We were just discussing how we should state our case.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yes. This is a difficult case. In order to win the debate, we will need to attack Stan and Kyle's credibility.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: What??

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: That's how you win these things: attack your opponents' credibility!  Butters! Take some kids and go dig up whatever dirt you can on Kyle's past. I'm talkin' booby magazines, whatever.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Wwuhuh-o-kay!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: The rest of you, go get the goods on Stan! His mom grounded him once for setting something on fire. Let's find out what that something was, and then lie and say it was a puppy.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Right.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Mmmm.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Cartman, we can't just attack Stan and Kyle's credibility. We need to present our side of the debate.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: You're right. We'll need to look like we prepared a case, too, so that they look all the weaker. Good plan. Sooo, what's the issue again?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: The South Park flag!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Interesting. Aaand, what side are we on?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: D'aaaaahhh!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Whoa! Calm down, ho.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: South Park City Hall, day. A Channel 4 field reporter is on scene. Chef is in the background dressed in a daishiki facing the Hall, with his fist up. Two groups of people are there, one on either side of him. The mayor and her assistants look out over the scene from her office

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Tom, I'm standing out front of the South Park Mayor's Office, where both sides of this debate have gathered.

text: Change the flag!

text: Well, I think the flag is racist! Huh, but then again, it is part of our history.

text: Well, I guess the flag is part of history, ...but I can see how it is racist.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: I think it is history. I think it is racist.

text: Well, one things for sure, tensions are high and pressure is mounting on the South Park Mayor to do something.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: ...Change the flag! Change the flag! Change the flag! Change the flag!  In the 1960's there was a monk  who set himself on fire to protest! You have left me no choice!  To protest your lack of humanity, I will now do the same thing!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Huh! Haaaaaaaaaaaah!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: White Power! White Power!  White Power! White Power!  White Power! White Power! White Power! White Power!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: White Power!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Change the flag!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Don't change history!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Chef, we realize that you find the South Park flag racist, and we certainly understand your case.  We have been diligently working on this problem, put in a lot of hours, and we have finally altered the flag in a way that we think will make you very happy. Gentlemen?  There. Is that better?

text: No, damnit!

text: No, but look! He's got a little smile now!  See? He's happy. Much better, don't you think?  Well, some people just won't with you at all. This is getting out of hand. How do I absolve myself of an responsibility with this?

text: Yes, of course. Let the children be responsible. Everybody loves children. Tell the press. South Park Elementary will be holding a vote on Friday!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Wendy's room, night. She rises in bed with a start. That scene in the meadow was a dream

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: AAAAAAaaaah!  Brrrrr. What's wrong with me?  Ahhh. It's okay. Get a grip, girl.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Wendih.  Wendih.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Aaaah!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Wendih, look at me.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh God, please don't let this be happening.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: South Park, the woods, deep in the night.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Alright brothers, listen up!  As you know, this fine city is holding a vote on whether or or not to change their flag. But lynching minorities is history! So what are we gonna do about it?!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Let's say that if they change the flag, we'll burn down the Capitol!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Let's say that if they change the flag, we'll never leave this town!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Let's say they should change the flag!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah!  Wah?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Uh what's that, brother?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: I thnk we should switch sides!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Me too. Nnn-that's a good idea.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Look, we have to accept the fact that most people in the world hate us, right?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah, m-hm.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: So, whatever side we're on is the side that's gonna lose, right?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Right, yeah.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: So why don't we all say that we want the flag changed. That way, most folks'll vote to keep it the way it is.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: That's a great idea, brother!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Alright, it is decided! We will officially tell everyone that we want the flag changed, so that they will all vote against us!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Hooray, yeah!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: We'e smart!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: That worked perfectly, Ned.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Well alright, now that that's out of the way, it is time to play, "Whose got the silliest thing on under their robe?"

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah, woohoo!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: The contest. The first member walks down the middle and shows off his boxers with a heart design. The second comes in and shows off his lederhosen. The third comes in and shows off bikini briefs and garters. The fourth comes in and shows off a yellow bird costume.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Jesus, Ned, these guys are completely nuts.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Mm-yup.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: the fifth member comes in and shows off his hand-walking skills, and the sixth one shows off his penis... Jimbo and Ned walk away from the scene

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: That is the most insane thing I've ever seen. I can't believe those people are on our side. I mean, is our side that crazy?  Oh, hello, Chef. Big debate tomorrow, I guess.  Oh, Jesus, the robes! Chef, this isn't what it looks like. You've gotta listen to us!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: I ain't gonna listen to nothin'! This whole cracker-ass town can kiss my ass!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Ned, I'm starting to think that maybe history ain't worth defendin' sometimes.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Wendy's house, morning, before school. Living room

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Thanks for coming over, Bebe. I have something to tell you.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Sure, what?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Bebe, I'm attracted to Cartman.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: I know.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Why would you tell me this? Why would you tell anyone this?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Because I don't know what to do. I can't concentrate, and if I can't concentrate, then I can't win the debate tomorrow. The whole vote is dependent on me doing a good job-

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Alright, look. When two people work closely for a long time, sometimes they feel what's called, "sexual tension." Sometimes you just have to act on impulse and get it over with.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: You mean, I should kiss him?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Kiss him and get it out of your system.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh God.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: South Park Elementary, the gym. Mr. Wyland is shown behind a podium, and the South Park flag hangs from some rafters behind him. Two tables are set up, one for each side of the debate. Behind the "FLAG SHOULD STAY THE SAME" table are Stan, Kyle, and two other boys. Behind the "FLAG SHOULD CHANGE" table are Wendy, Cartman, Token, and Butters.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Well I certainly would like to thank all the parents for their support of our debate club.  I r-realize that many of you are torn by the issues as well, so, perhaps the children can shed some light on us. We'll start with Wendy Testaburger on the "Flag Should Be Changed" team.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: The-  the- uh,  aheh ahum,  the... the- uh,  Ahhhhh,  The first argument we- ah...  Let me start over.  The uh-  oh God. Could you all excuse me for a moment?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh, God!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yes. Now, the main point we would like to make is oftentimes it is prudent to change history. As times change we hope to grow, and as we grow our rules must change. It is a natural part of evolution. Thank you.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Okay, and Kyle and Stan's team, your main point?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Our main point is that the flag shouldn't offend anyone, because killing has been around since the bieginning of time. All animals kill.  And the animals that don't kill are stupid ones, like cows and turtles and stuff. So people should not be so upset about killing.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Whoa whoa whooaa! You just missed the point entirely!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Huh?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: I'm not mad because the flag shows somebody gettin' killed, It's because it's racist!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Racist??

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Children, don't you even know what this argument is about?! That flag is racist because a black man is being hung by white people.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Ooooooohhh.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Ooooooohhh?!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: W-we really didn't see it that way.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: But that's a black man up there!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Y-yeah, but... the color of someone's skin doesn't matter.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Well of course it matters when-  ...Oh my God. Wait a minute. You children didn't even see the flag as a black man being hanged by white people, did you?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: No.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Why, that is- that is the most beautiful thing I have ever heard.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: What?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: What?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Don't you see? All this time I thought these little crackers had turned racist, when actuallih they were so not racist that they didn't even make a separation of black and white to begin with. All they saw when they looked at that flag was five people.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Awww.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Awww.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: I'm sorry, children. I was wrong about you. But I still the flag needs to be changed. But now I realize that I almost let racism turn me into a racist.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah. You know, uh I suddenly found myself on the side of Klan menbers. I've never had anything against blacks, Chef.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh, I know you don't, Jimbo. I've known you for almost ten years. You're a good man.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: We've been way too divisive over this, Chef. Maybe we can come up with a- compromise flagsomething that everybody can be happy with.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: I think that's a much better start than me tryin' to separate myself from all you wonderful crackers.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Ooh, huhuh. Oooh

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh. Sweet, dude. I don't think we have to do this stupid debate now.  Stan?

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: South Park City Hall, day. The Mayor has called a town meeting at City Hall and now stands at her podium with the town gathered before her. Something hangs above her covered by a brown curtain

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: This has been an interesting week in South Park. We've all done a lot of growing this week.  Everyone was afraid to take a stand on this issue. But now we have learned once again that black, white, yellow, brown, or whatever, we are all just people. And so, I am very excited to unveil our new South Park Flag!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Wait, I don't get it.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: No, see? There's people of all colors. And they added a black guy as one of the hangers, too, so it's not racist.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Hooray!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: I have to admit it, that is a lot nicer.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Phew. I'm sure glad that's over with.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Me, too!

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: I can't believe how right Bebe was about feeling under pressure with somebody. As soon as it was over, all my feelings for you just vanished.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Oh, huh. Yeah. Yeah, totally huh.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: I'm totally back to normal. See you later.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Yeah. See you later, heh. Ho, huhuh, he, haha.

title: CHEF GOES NANNERS
text: Hahaha.  Stan. Stan, wait up!
